page.title: 04BISHOPSBOURNE VILLAGE (2)
page.content: Unlike many villages where the addit- ion of modern housing has increased the population, Bishopsbourne, with no new development, has seen its populat- ion decline steadily, reaching an est- imated low for the village of 80 in 1975 since when it has risen slightly. Many of the residents are middle-aged or retired and this is partly due to the lack of suitable housing for young families. In the village there is no through traffic, street lighting, car- parking areas, pavements, schools, doctors and hardly any employment. The Mermaid Inn is very popular, serving excellent bar meals. It attracts many visitors which adds to the parking problems. In 1984 the local forge re-opened; thus reviving a link with "Ye forge at Burnes"(Domesday Book). The Smith specializes in high class architectural iron work.
